Candentity.name: New_Zealand_Parliament_Buildings
Candentity.desc: The New Zealand Parliament Buildings, located in Wellington, comprise a 45,000 square meter site featuring the Parliament House, Parliamentary Library, "The Beehive" executive wing, and Bowen House, with an overall setting lacking aesthetic or architectural coherence.

Candentity.name: Parliament_Building_(Quebec)

Candentity.name: Superhabitable_planet
Candentity.desc: A superhabitable planet is a hypothetical exoplanet or exomoon that may be better suited for the emergence and evolution of life than Earth, with characteristics such as larger size, warmer temperatures, and older age, and orbiting K-type main-sequence stars.

Candentity.name: Exoplanet_naming_convention
Candentity.desc: The exoplanet naming convention is a system used by the International Astronomical Union to name exoplanets, typically by adding a lowercase letter to the name of its parent star, with some exceptions for circumbinary planets and a limited number of officially sanctioned names.

Candentity.name: Gas_giant
Candentity.desc: A gas giant is a type of giant planet primarily composed of hydrogen and helium, characterized by a layer of metallic hydrogen and a rocky core, with Jupiter and Saturn being the most well-known examples in our Solar System.

Candentity.name: Exoplanet_(album)
Candentity.desc: Exoplanet is the debut studio album by progressive metal band The Contortionist, released in 2010 and featuring a remastered edition in 2016.

Candentity.name: NASA_Exoplanet_Archive
Candentity.desc: The NASA Exoplanet Archive is an online catalog and data service that collects and serves public data on extra-solar planets and their host stars, providing tools and services for analyzing and displaying transit data from various surveys and missions.

Candentity.name: Extragalactic_planet
Candentity.desc: An extragalactic planet is a star-bound or rogue planet located outside the Milky Way Galaxy, which is extremely difficult to detect directly due to vast distances, with the most distant known planets being SWEEPS-11 and SWEEPS-04, approximately 27,710 light-years from the Sun.

Candentity.name: Methods_of_detecting_exoplanets
Candentity.desc: Methods of detecting exoplanets involve indirect methods, such as Doppler spectroscopy, due to the faint light of the planet compared to its parent star and the glare from the star.

Candentity.name: Exoplanet
Candentity.desc: An exoplanet is a planet outside the Solar System, with over 4,400 confirmed exoplanets in 3,257 systems, detected using various methods, and with some potentially habitable and hosting liquid water, sparking interest in the search for extraterrestrial life.

Candentity.name: Extraterrestrial_atmosphere
Candentity.desc: The study of extraterrestrial atmospheres is an active field of research that explores the atmospheres of various astronomical objects, including planets, moons, comets, and the Sun, to gain insight into Earth's atmosphere and understand atmospheric processes.

Candentity.name: FIFA_World_Cup

Candentity.name: FIFA_International_Referees_List

Candentity.name: FIFA_(video_game_series)

Candentity.name: FIFA

Candentity.name: FIFA_Women%27s_World_Cup

Candentity.name: Space_Shuttle_Discovery
Candentity.desc: Space Shuttle Discovery is one of NASA's five fully operational orbiters, launched in 1984, and flew 39 missions over 27 years, carrying out research, International Space Station assembly, and Hubble Space Telescope deployment, before being retired and now on display at the Smithsonian National Air and Space Museum.

Candentity.desc: Discovery II is a sternwheel riverboat built in 1971, still in operation as a tour vessel on the Chena and Tanana rivers near Fairbanks, Alaska.
